## What is `SRA Toolkit`?  
  
From NCBI:  
```
The SRA Toolkit by NCBI enables reading ("dumping") of sequencing files from the SRA database and writing ("loading") files into the .sra format.
```  
  
To expand a bit further, SRA Toolkit allows users to downlaod, read and write files in the SRA (Sequence Read Archive) format. The SRA format is a one way in which NCBI stores sequence data obtained from next generation sequencing. 
  
## Downloading and Installing latest version (last update March 2019)
  
**Using wget**  
  
`wget "ftp://ftp-trace.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra/sdk/current/sratoolkit.current-centos_linux64.tar.gz"`  

if using Linux then unpack the file with  
  
`tar -xzf sratoolkit.current-centos_linux64.tar.gz`
  
**Using ```apt install```**
  
sudo apt install sra-toolkit  
  
[Latest instructions from there website](https://trace.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Traces/sra/sra.cgi?view=toolkit_doc&f=std)
